articles.title: Kim Jong Un Congratulates Putin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Congratulates Putin
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, president of the Russian Federation.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend my heartfelt congratulations to you on your reelection as president of the Russian Federation.
					
					 Your reelection as president is an expression of your people's great support and trust in you.
					
					 Being convinced that the DPRK-Russia relations of friendship and cooperation with a long history would continue to develop in depth in line with the desire and wishes of the peoples of the two countries, I wish you bigger success in your work to build powerful Russia.

articles.title: Congratulations to Chairman of China's NPC Standing Committee
articles.content:
Congratulations to Chairman of China's NPC Standing Committee
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on March 17 sent a congratulatory message to Li Zhanshu, chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of the People's Republic of China.
					 In the message Kim Yong Nam extended warm congratulations to him on his election as chairman of the NPC Standing Committee at the first meeting of the 13th NPC. 
					
					 Hoping that the Chinese people would make good success in building socialism with the Chinese characteristics in the new era under the leadership of the Communist Party of China, the message wished him success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Congratulations to Premier of China
articles.content:
Congratulations to Premier of China
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, on March 18 sent a congratulatory message to Li Keqiang upon his re-assumption of office as premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.
					 The message wished him success in his responsible work, hoping that the Chinese people would achieve sustained and sound development of economy under the leadership of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho on Monday sent a similar message to Wang Yi upon his appointment as state councilor and foreign minister of China.

articles.title: Greetings to Tunisian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Tunisian President
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Mohamed Al Beji Caid Essebssi, president of the Republic of Tunisia, on its 62nd national day.
					 In the message Kim Yong Nam sincerely wished the friendly Tunisian people bigger progress and prosperity, expressing the belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Tunisia would grow stronger.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Inspects Various Units in South Hwanghae Province
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Inspects Various Units in South Hwanghae Province
 Haeju, March 20 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, made a field survey of various units in South Hwanghae Province.
					 Going round the Haeju Trailing Farm Machine Factory and the Ohyon Co-op Farm in Yonan County which are associated with leadership exploits of the peerless great men, the premier encouraged workers and agricultural workers busy with farm machine production and preparations for farming.
					
					 At consultative meetings, measures were taken to produce more farm machines through technical updating of production process and give fullest play to the advantages of a field-responsibility-system within the framework of sub-workteam management system and increase the double-cropping fields while intensifying the movement for high yield.
					
					 He also inspected the Haeju Mushroom Farm, the construction site of the Paechon Catfish Farm and other units to learn in detail about the production and construction. He discussed the issue of new power source development in the Ryongdang area.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Minister Returns Home
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister Returns Home
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, foreign minister of the DPRK, and his party came back home Tuesday after visiting the Kingdom of Sweden.

articles.title: DPRK SPA Delegation Leaves for Switzerland
articles.content:
DPRK SPA Delegation Leaves for Switzerland
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK led by deputy Ri Jong Hyok, director of the National Reunification Institute, left here Tuesday to take part in the 138th Conference of the Inter-Parliamentary Union due in Geneva of Switzerland.

articles.title: Russian Government Economic Delegation Here
articles.content:
Russian Government Economic Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A Russian government economic delegation led by Minister of Development of Far East Alexandr Galushka, chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia intergovernmental committee for cooperation in trade, economy and science and technology, arrived here Tuesday to take part in the 8th meeting of the committee.

articles.title: Participants in Technological Innovation Exhibition Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Participants in Technological Innovation Exhibition Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 5th national technological innovation exhibition of three-revolution teams visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Tuesday.
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues in the palace.
					
					 At the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state, the participants made bows to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the great leaders received are on display and halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their revolutionary life.

articles.title: Wreaths Sent to Vietnamese Embassy
articles.content:
Wreaths Sent to Vietnamese Embassy
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK institutions sent wreaths to the Vietnamese embassy here on Mar. 20 in memory of the late Phan Van Khai, former prime minister of Vietnam.
					 Placed at his photo were wreaths from the Foreign Ministry, Ministry of External Economic Relations, Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the General Bureau for Affairs with Diplomatic Corps.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned.
					
					 They paid a silent tribute to the memory of the deceased and made entries in the condolence book.

articles.title: 33rd Sci-Tech Festival of Ministry of Railways Opens
articles.content:
33rd Sci-Tech Festival of Ministry of Railways Opens
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The 33rd sci-tech festival of the Ministry of Railways was opened with due ceremony on Tuesday.
					 Divided into machine, construction, electronic data operation and electricity panels, the festival will take the forms of sci-tech achievements presentation, show and new technology swapping.
					
					 Presented to the festival were more than 100 data.

articles.title: Study Tour Group Meets in Kanggye
articles.content:
Study Tour Group Meets in Kanggye
 Kanggye, March 20 (KCNA) -- The expedition of schoolchildren from across the country, who are making a 250-mile journey for learning, arrived in Kanggye City on Mar. 19.
					 After leaving Phophyong on Mar. 16, its members reached Kanggye through Wolthan, Hwaphyong, Huksu and Janggang areas.
					
					 Kanggye, associated with the traces of President Kim Il Sung, is a place where he dropped in to send his father Kim Hyong Jik a telegraphic message saying "Safe Arrival at Kanggye" during his 250-mile journey for learning.
					
					 Working people and school youth and children in the city gave warm welcome to those marchers coming while singing revolutionary songs.
					
					 The study tour makers placed a floral basket at the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in the city and made bows to them.
					
					 They had a meeting for sending a telegraphic message on their arrival to respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un at the Kanggye Post Office Revolutionary Site on Mar. 20.
					
					 The message to Kim Jong Un was read out at the meeting.
					
					 The tour group makers in the message made a report to 
					
					Kim Jong Un that they had arrived in Kanggye safely after leaving Phophyong on the day when the President started the journey for learning.
					
					 After the meeting they went round the Kanggye Post Office, Kanggye Inn Revolutionary Site and the Jagang Provincial Revolutionary Museum.
					
					 The study tour of Mangyongdae continues.

articles.title: Production of Juche Fertilizer Increases in DPRK
articles.content:
Production of Juche Fertilizer Increases in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Big efforts have been paid to fertilizer production in the DPRK.
					 The Namhung Youth Chemical Complex, one of leading chemical enterprises in the country, increases the production of Juche fertilizer this year, the third year of implementing the five-year strategy for national economic development.
					
					 According to data available, it has produced a thousand and hundreds tons of fertilizer on a daily average as of the middle of March. From the beginning of the new manuring year to the present, the complex has turned out hundreds of thousands tons of Juche fertilizer.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex boosts the production by strengthening ties with preceding processes.

articles.title: Achievements Made in Central Tree Nursery
articles.content:
Achievements Made in Central Tree Nursery
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The entire Party, the whole army and all the people in the DPRK have turned out in a vigorous forest restoration campaign since respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un gave field guidance to the Central Tree Nursery under the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection in November Juche 103 (2014). The Central Tree Nursery has made many achievements in the campaign for three years.
					 It has spread hundreds of tons of substrate and manure on cultivation fields and produced hundreds of thousands of square meters of sunshade texture and nonwoven fiber fabric every year to send them to tree nurseries across the country. 
					
					 It has cultivated more than 26 millions of tree saplings every year, including Pinus strobes, Larix lepolepis and Robinia pseudoacacia, and sent them to sites for forest restoration.
					
					 True to the Workers' Party of Korea's intention to plant trees in all seasons, it completed the cultivation method of tens of kinds of six to fifteen-year-old potted saplings and summer tree planting method till 2016 and the cultivation method of one to four-year-old potted saplings and summer tree planting method in 2017.
					
					 On the basis of a detailed research and analysis of biological characteristics of good species of trees of other countries, it acclimatized more than 70 species of trees and established their propagation method till late 2017.
					
					 The nursery is putting sapling production on a higher scientific, industrial and intensive basis. It is the modern production base left as legacy by leader Kim Jong Il who always paid deep attention to afforestation.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Urged to Behave Themselves
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Urged to Behave Themselves
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Recently Prime Minister of Japan Abe said the present situation on the Korean Peninsula serves as evidence of effect of sanctions upon the DPRK, stressing the need to be cautious of the circumstances of the peninsula. Meanwhile, the foreign minister, chief Cabinet secretary, defense minister and other heavyweights of Japan vied with each other to say that "maximum pressure" upon the DPRK should be maintained as ever and that Japan supports the U.S. statement that all the options related to the Korean issue including military action are on the table, underscoring the need to take cautious approach toward the DPRK's intention.
					 This is a revelation of the inveterate habit of Japan to fish in troubled waters by aggravating the situation on the Korean Peninsula and it is nothing but the last-ditch effort to reverse the good trend of the times, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' intention is to instill the Japanese people with the necessity for turning Japan into a military giant and create international circumstances favorable for Japan to legally embark on the road of overseas aggression.
					
					 The trend of the times will not change no matter how desperately the Japanese reactionaries may try.
					
					 If they persistently come out as shock brigade in ratcheting up pressure on the DPRK, reeling off reckless remarks, they would face a catastrophic fate.
					
					 The Abe group should behave themselves, mindful that their illiberal moves would result in pricking their own eyes.
					
					 If Japan continues to do as now, it will be an outcast.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Sincerely Approach Issue of Redemption of Past Wrongs
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Sincerely Approach Issue of Redemption of Past Wrongs
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Detailed data about the monuments to the sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army being erected in different parts of the world continue to be posted on Wikipedia. According to it, countries building the monuments are on the steady increase including the U.S., Canada, Australia and China, to say nothing of south Korea. In the U.S. alone, such monuments have been built in eight regions including New York, Los Angeles, California and Michigan.
					 Kim Hong Hwi, a researcher of the Institute for Japan Studies, in a commentary contributed to Minju Joson Tuesday, said that it is the universally recognized understanding of the world that the issue of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army is a historical issue pending a solution and that it shows Japan's desperate act to evade the redemption of the past wrongs will touch off stronger rebuff of the international community.
					
					 As unanimously commented by the international community, the crime related to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army is not an issue that can be settled with a few pennies, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 No statute of limitations is applicable to the crimes related to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and this is a crucial political issue that has to be settled generation after generation until it is properly settled in the light of international justice and on principle of impartiality.
					
					 But shameless and naive Japan with a narrow-minded view on political issue, being elated after giving a few pennies, claims the sexual slavery issue has seen a perfect, final and irreversible solution only to enrage all people.
					
					 Japan has to clearly understand.
					
					 It is as foolish an act as trying to stop river with a rotten plank to gloss over the strong international demand for the solution to the sexual slavery issue.
					
					 Japan has to come out for the redemption of the past wrongs from a sincere stand, clearly understanding that it can never get rid of the responsibility for the crimes related to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.

articles.title: KCNA Blasts Dishonest Forces' Distortion of Truth
articles.content:
KCNA Blasts Dishonest Forces' Distortion of Truth
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency issued a commentary titled "Truth Must Not Be Distorted with Sheer Sophism" on Tuesday.
					 The commentary noted that thanks to the proactive measure and peace-loving proposal made by the DPRK, dramatic atmosphere for reconciliation has been created in relations between the north and the south of Korea and there has been a sign of change also in the DPRK-U.S. relations.
					
					 At this time, the dishonest forces in the U.S. and Japan and the conservative group of south Korea are peddling groundless stories distorting the truth in a bid to mislead public opinion, the commentary said, citing facts.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Incumbent and former officials and experts of the U.S. have become vocal, claiming that "north Korea took a change-about attitude even though the U.S. did not make any concession", "Trump's high-intensity sanctions and pressure strategy proves effective" and "it is a sign that north Korea has reached a limit beyond which it can no longer sustain itself", in an attempt to meet their own interests.
					
					 The Abe group, which is left alone as a result of the unexpected sudden change in the situation of the Korean peninsula, claims that "north Korea's dialogue and peace offensive is a result of the sustained pressure put by the international community" and "hasty dialogue would mean being taken in by north Korea's strategy of gaining time" and that "sanctions should never be slackened under any circumstances".
					
					 In the meantime, the conservatives of south Korea including the "Liberal Korea Party", conservative media and self-professed experts are reeling off invective that "it is a trite method for the north to opt for dialogue whenever it finds itself in a fix", "it is camouflaged peace offensive" and "it is aimed to make a crack in south Korea-U.S. alliance and to seek lift of sanctions".
					
					 The great change in the north-south relations is not an accidental one but a noble fruition made thanks to the DPRK's proactive measure, warm compatriotism and will for defending peace. Such an event as today could be possible as the DPRK's dignity has remarkably risen and it has strong might.
					
					 Such rubbish as "result of sanctions and pressure" and sort of "limit" spread by the hostile forces is just as meaningless as a dog barking at the moon.
					
					 The economy of the DPRK is rising, not sitting down as claimed by the riff-raffs, and is being put on a Juche and modern basis. Sci-tech achievements and models have been created in different parts of the country, promising the bright future for the improvement of the people's living standard.
					
					 It is by no means accidental that the public at home and abroad are unanimously commenting that the dialogue peace offensive of the DPRK is an expression of self-confidence as it has acquired everything it desires.
					
					 It is really an expression of small-mindedness for the riff-raffs to spoil the atmosphere and say this or that even before the parties concerned are given a chance to study the inner thoughts of the other side and are seated at a negotiating table.
					
					 We do like to remind that it is time for all to approach everything with prudence with self-control and patience.
					
					 The fault-finders have to face up to the unanimous demand of the public at home and abroad for the improvement of the north-south relations and for peace on the Korean peninsula and stop the mean act of distorting truth.

articles.title: New Remains Discovered in S. Korea to Reveal Massacres
articles.content:
New Remains Discovered in S. Korea to Reveal Massacres
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Remains of people, who were killed by the military police and right-wing gangsters during the Korean War, have been continuously unearthed in south Korea.
					 Remains of hundreds of people massacred by the police and the "Homeland Defence Group", a right-wing reactionary organization, between October 1950 and January 1951 were discovered under a dead pit in Jung-ri, Paebang-myon of Asan City, South Chungchong Province, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People on March 16.
					
					 Bones of women and children were piled up on the spot. There were silver hairpins, ring pair, toys, buttons, hair, rubber shoes and bullets and empty cartridges of U.S.-made carbines.
					
					 The murderers massacred at least 300 people for the reason that they helped the People's Army.
					
					 According to the witnesses, 70-80 percent of those were women and children.
					
					 After killing those people, the murderers did not hesitate to burn the corpses to cover up their crimes.

articles.title: Violence against S. Korean Taxi Driver by GIs
articles.content:
Violence against S. Korean Taxi Driver by GIs
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Two soldiers of the U.S. imperialist aggression army in south Korea assaulted a taxi driver in Sogyo-dong, Mapho District in Seoul at dawn of March 11, according to the south Korean MBC.
					 They hit the taxi driver on the face when he demanded proper taxi fee.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Lebanon
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Lebanon
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A Lebanese preparatory committee for celebrating the 106th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed on March 12.
					 Zaher al Khatib, secretary general of the Lebanon Federation of Workers and chairman of the Lebanese Committee for Support to the Reunification of Korea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from March 12 to April 15 and decided to give wide publicity to the exploits of Kim Il Sung through media and hold various political and cultural events in this period.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in France
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in France
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A French preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun, was formed on March 9.
					 Benoit Quennedey, president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize a seminar, lecture and other political and cultural events on the occasion of the 106th birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Algeria
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Algeria
 Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung - the Day of the Sun - was formed by the General Youth Union of Algeria on Mar. 12.
					 Muhammad Nouwar Al Rabie Kabaili, chairman of the union, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize such political and cultural events as celebration meeting, photo exhibition and film show to mark the 106th birth anniversary of the President.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un felicita a Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un felicita a Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Presidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Jong Un, envio el dia 20 un mensaje de felicitacion al Presidente de la Federacion Rusa, Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin.
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Le extiendo mis sinceras felicitaciones por su reeleccion como Presidente de la Federacion Rusa.
					
					Su reeleccion testimonia el gran apoyo y confianza del pueblo de vuestro pais sobre usted.
					
					Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-Rusia de larga historia seguiran profundizandose y desarrollandose en el futuro tambien de acuerdo con la aspiracion y el deseo de los pueblos de ambos paises, formulo votos por mayores exitos en su trabajo por construir la poderosa Rusia.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a Li Zhanshu
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a Li Zhanshu
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 17 un mensaje de felicitacion a Li Zhanshu, presidente del Comite Permanente de la Asamblea Popular Nacional de la Republica Popular China.
					En su mensaje Kim envio calurosas felicitaciones a Li Zhanshu elegido como presidente del Comite Permanente de la Asamblea Popular Nacional de la Republica Popular China en la primera sesion de la XIII Legislatura de la APN.
					
					El remitente deseo que el pueblo chino alcance excelentes exitos en la construccion del socialismo con peculiaridades chinas de la nueva epoca bajo la guia del Partido Comunista de China y formulo votos por exitos en las responsabilidades del destinatario.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju envia mensaje de felicitacion a Li Keqiang
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju envia mensaje de felicitacion a Li Keqiang
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ACNC) -- Pak Pong Ju, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado y primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 18 un mensaje de felicitacion a Li Keqiang, reelecto como primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China.
					 En su misiva, el remitente deseo que el pueblo chino logre el constante y sano desarrollo de la economia bajo la direccion del Partido Comunista de China y formulo votos por los exitos en las responsabilidades del destinatario.
					
					 Por otra parte, el canciller coreano Ri Yong Ho emitio el dia 19 un mensaje de felicitacion a Wang Yi, nombrado como consejero de Estado y ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de China.

articles.title: Japon debe tomar actitud sincera en liquidar crimenes del pasado, exige Kim Hong Hwi
articles.content:
Japon debe tomar actitud sincera en liquidar crimenes del pasado, exige Kim Hong Hwi
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ACNC) -- En la enciclopedia online Wikipedia se leen los datos detallados sobre las lapidas en memoria de las esclavas sexuales para el viejo ejercito japones.
					 Segun ellos, se aumenta el numero de los paises que las construyen, incluyendo el Sur de Corea, EE.UU., Canada, Australia y China.
					
					En el caso de EE.UU., se levantaron en Nueva York, Los Angeles, California, Michigan y otras 4 regiones. 
					
					 En su comentario publicado en el rotativo Minju Joson fechado 20, el investigador del Instituto de los Asuntos Japoneses, Kim Hong Hwi, adelanto que el mundo comparte la nocion de que el tema de esclavitud sexual para las tropas japonesas es el pendiente de la historia.
					
					 A medida que Japon actua con mas desesperacion para eludir la liquidacion de su expediente criminal, se torna mas fuerte el rechazo de la sociedad internacional, apunto Kim y prosiguio:
					
					 Como insiste unanimemente la sociedad internacional, ese problema no es el que se resuelve con sumas insignificantes de dinero.
					
					 Resulta el importante asunto politico que no tiene prescripcion y debe ser balanceado de generacion en generacion hasta que se resuelva correctamente en el principio de justicia internacional e imparcialidad.
					
					  Sin embargo, Japon, pais descarado, mezquino y estrecho de vision politica, dice que el problema de esclavitud sexual ha sido resuelto de manera total, definitiva e irreversible, ufanandose de haber pagado sumas miserables. Este hecho causa la indignacion de todo el mundo.
					
					  Japon debe conocer que es irrealizable su intento de soslayar la fuerte demanda de la sociedad internacional sobre la solucion del problema.
					
					  Debera liquidar con actitud sincera sus crimenes del pasado teniendo presente que no podra eludir nunca la responsabilidad.

articles.title: No deben distorsionar la verdad con sofisma: comentario de ACNC
articles.content:
No deben distorsionar la verdad con sofisma: comentario de ACNC
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ACNC) -- La Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea publico el dia 20 un comentario titulado "No deben distorsionar la verdad con sofisma".
					Gracias a las medidas protagonicas y la propuesta pacifista de la RPDC, se crea ultimamente el dramatico ambiente de reconciliacion entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea y se observan indicios de cambio tambien en las relaciones RPDC-EE.UU., comienza el comentario y continua:
					
					En tales circunstancias, las fuerzas malsanas de EE.UU. y Japon y la banda conservadora surcoreana inducen en error la opinion publica circulando los rumores que tergiversan la verdad.
					
					Los funcionarios en servicio activo y retirados y los especialistas de EE.UU. disparatean que "el Norte de Corea asumio la actitud propensa al cambio aunque EE.UU. no hizo ninguna concesion", "esto es efecto de la estrategia de sancion y presion superduras de Trump" y "muestra que el Norte de Corea llega al punto limite que no puede resistir mas".
					
					La banda de Abe, aislada por el cambio inesperado y brusco de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana, charlotea que "la ofensiva de dialogo y paz del Norte de Corea es el resultado de la presion sostenida de la sociedad internacional", "el dialogo precipitado significa dejarse enganar ante la artimana del Norte de Corea para ganarse el tiempo" y "no se debe relajar en ningun caso la sancion".
					
					Mientras tanto, el Partido de Corea Libre y otros tipejos, medios de prensa y expertos conservadores del Sur de Corea chismean que "el dialogo es el metodo rutinario que usa el Norte cada vez que se halla en aprieto", "ofensiva de paz disfrazada" y "trampa para romper la alianza Sur de Corea-EE.UU. y atenuar la sancion".
					
					El gran cambio de relaciones intercoreanas no es una casualidad divina, sino es el fruto valioso de la iniciativa, la calida fraternidad y la voluntad de defender la paz de la RPDC.
					
					Ademas, los acontecimientos actuales han sido posibles gracias a la elevacion extraordinaria del prestigio de la RPDC y su gran poderio nacional. 
					
					Sin embargo, las fuerzas hostiles hablan ridicula y absurdamente del supuesto "resultado de sancion y presion" y el "punto limite".
					
					Nuestra economia no se derrumba como hablan las gentuzas, sino se levanta dignamente hacia la realizacion de la jucheanizacion y modernizacion y se crean por doquier del pais los exitos cientifico-tecnicos y los prototipos que aseguran la radiante perspectiva de la mejora de vida del pueblo.
					
					 No es casual que la opinion publica interna y externa evalue unanimemente que la ofensiva de dialogo y paz de la RPDC deviene la expresion de la confianza en si misma por haber cumplido y tenido todo lo necesario.
					
					  Resulta muy iliberal los actos de la chusma que dice esto y lo otro enturbiando el ambiente sin saber el intento de ambas partes y antes del inicio del dialogo.
					
					 Aconsejamos que ahora es el tiempo en que tienen que portarse discretamente con la paciencia. 
					
					  Los criticastros deben abandonar su farsa pueril para tergiversar la verdad viendo correctamente la aspiracion y demanda unanimes de los nacionales y extranjeros que desean la mejora de las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas y la paz de la Peninsula Coreana.
